Jim & Rich,

By coincedence I was reading up on the Bushu schools
this morning as I tried to confirm a mei on a Bushu
tsuba smith. I'm not having much luck, so may beg
Jim's help later.

I looked at your tsuba and thought Bushu Ito. I wanted
to see if I could find similar example in some of the
books I had out. It has some of that richness of 3-D
carving(?) that always makes me wonder 'Umetada'.

But this one looks so clean and the metal so dark &
smooth with no gold loss, and a large seppa dai. No
chance its modern or at least post-Edo? Very clean
piece.
   
Curran
